action.action-desc: Mr. Royce (for himself and Mr. Huffman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Credit Union Act to exclude a loan secured by a non-owner occupied 1- to 4-family dwelling from the definition of a member business loan, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Credit Union Residential Loan Parity Act.

section.header: Treatment of a non-owner occupied 1- to 4-family dwelling

subsection.header: Removal from member business loan limitation
subsection.text: Section 107A(c)(1)(B)(i) of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1757a(c)(1)(B)(i)) is amended by striking that is the primary residence of a member.

Nothing in this Act or the amendment made by this Act shall preclude the National Credit Union Administration from treating an extension of credit that is fully secured by a lien on a 1- to 4-family dwelling that is not the primary residence of a member as a member business loan for purposes other than the member business loan limitation requirements under section 107A of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1757a).
